Bernard Quatermass

A fictional scientist, originally created by the writer Nigel Kneale for BBC Television. An intelligent and highly moral British scientist, the character of Quatermass has been described by BBC News Online as Britain's first television hero.

  • The Quatermass Experiment

    TV Series by BBC Television in 1953 and remade by the BBC as a live broadcast in 2005. It was also remade as a film in 1955 by Hammer Films. Quatermass was played by Reginald Tate (1953) , Brian Donlevy (1955) and Jason Flemyn (2005)

    Set in the near future against the background of a British space programme, it tells the story of the first crewed flight into space, supervised by Professor Bernard Quatermass of the British Experimental Rocket Group.

  • Quatermass II

    Quatermass II was a TV series made and broadcast by BBC Television in 1955. It was remade as a film by Hammer Films in 1957. Quatermass was played by John Robinson (1955) and Brian Donlevy (1957)

    The serial sees Professor Bernard Quatermass of the British Experimental Rocket Group being asked to examine strange meteorite showers. His investigations lead to his uncovering a conspiracy involving alien infiltration at the highest levels of the British government.

  • Quatermass and the pit

    A British television science-fiction serial transmitted live by BBC Television in December 1958 and January 1959, and remade by Hammer Films (released in 1967). Quatermass was played by André Morell (1958 – 1959) and Andrew Keir (1967)

    The serial continues the loose chronology of the Quatermass adventures. Workmen excavating a site in Knightsbridge, London, discover a strange skull and what at first appears to be an unexploded bomb. Quatermass and his newly appointed military superior at the British Rocket Group, Colonel Breen, become involved in the investigation when it becomes apparent that the object is an alien spacecraft.

  • Quatermass (The Quatermass Conclusion / Quatermass IV)

    A 1979 British television science fiction serial and produced by Euston Films for Thames Television, it was broadcast on the ITV network in October and November 1979. An abridged version was shot simultaneously as an 100 minute film however it received only a limited theatrical release. Quatermass was played by John Mills (1979)

    Quatermass is set in a near future in which large numbers of young people are joining a cult known as the Planet People who gather at prehistoric sites, believing they will be transported to a better life on another planet. The series begins with Professor Quatermass arriving in London to look for his granddaughter, Hettie Carlson, and witnessing the destruction of two spacecraft and the disappearance of a group of Planet People at a stone circle by an unknown force.
